title: PMO Manager
content:
The PMO Manager will work within the Group Transformation function as a member of the Enterprise PMO management team. The role will work across the Group Transformation portfolio to provide full lifecycle governance, assurance and support services.  
The PMO Manager role is key in the development of the Enterprise PMO team to increase the maturity level of project delivery and controls within Group Transformation and across JD overall.  
 You will lead a team of PMO Analysts to work closely with Group Transformation project and programme teams through the full delivery lifecycle to implement effective PMO services to enhance delivery success.  
·       Job Title – PMO Manager
·       Location – BL9 8RR
·       Working rota –  Monday-Friday
·       Working hours – 40
What You'll Be Doing:   
As a PMO Manager you'll be doing the following: 

Work closely with the Enterprise PMO Director and other EPMO leadership colleagues to implement and continually improve the Enterprise PMO strategy, services and deliverables  
Establish programme and project management frameworks and standards to deliver an effective PMO Service Catalogue 
Manage assurance processes to support effective change delivery across programmes and projects  
Work alongside delivery teams from Group Transformation and across the wider business to provide independent assurance on change activities highlighting areas of concern and intervention points 

What We're Looking For:

3+ years PMO Management experience  
Experience in the set-up and ongoing development of project governance and assurance processes across programmes and projects  
Experience in project and change management methodologies and approaches in waterfall and agile environments  
Experience in leading project assurance reviews of large change programmes  
Experience in programme and project planning to identify critical path, milestones, dependencies and resource requirements and forecast  

The Company:
The JD Group is a leading omnichannel retailer of Sports Fashion, Street & Premium Fashion, Outdoors and Gyms with over 60,000 colleagues over 3,400 stores across several retail fascia's in over 30 markets around the world.
We are an equal opportunities employer who embraces and values differences. We recognise the importance of an inclusive workplace culture in which everyone can thrive irrespective of their background or identity.
To be a part of this successful and continuously growing company, you will have the desire to ingrain our strategic goals of being a people first, a digital leader and customer focused organisation which provides operational excellence and is continuous with identifying new areas of growth into our day to day.
We know our employees work tirelessly to make JD sports the success it is today and in turn, we offer them some amazing benefits:

Incremental Holiday Allowance
Staff Discount on qualifying purchases across Group retail stores and online
Exclusive Colleague Bike Discount scheme
Discounted Gym membership
Personal development opportunities to learn and develop at work
Access to Apprenticeships and accredited qualifications

Interested? 
If you interested in this position, then press the Apply Now button.
Due to the high volumes of applications our opportunities attract, it takes time to review them all. If you don't hear back within two weeks of you applying, please consider your application to have been unsuccessful on this occasion
Applications that meet the skills criteria will be contacted for a 1st stage meeting with the talent team. Shortlisted candidates will then be invited to interview with the hiring manager.
Thank you again for your time.
